etymologies: late 16th century: from French temporiser ‘bide one's time’, from medieval Latin temporizare ‘to delay’, from Latin tempus, tempor- ‘time’

definitions: avoid making a decision or committing oneself in order to gain time

examples.text: the opportunity was missed because the mayor still temporized

shortDefinitions: avoid making decision or committing oneself

definitions: temporarily adopt a particular course in order to conform to the circumstances

examples.text: their unwillingness to temporize had driven their country straight into conflict with France
